reviews.text: Picturesque train station in Wiltshire. Bricks need a scrub and woodwork lintels & bridge need a lick of paint. I wish there were more of these "historic" stations around, but this is the first one I've seen in awhile. Traveling off-peak, I didnt have any issues with crowded trains. Service to/from Temple Meads Bristol is run by GWR (Wasn't late on day I traveled) If they maintained the brick and woodwork here, I would have awarded 5 stars. Well-tended flower boxes are a nice touch.
Bradford-on-Avon is a small pretty little town.  Well worth a visit and is very popular with local, tourists and plenty of visiting canal barges.
Good place to visit lots to see

I live in Bradford on Avon,& used the station to commute for years. Back in 2015 to 2017 they had fabulous
staff, friendly & helpful. Some of those staff still remain, but 1 or 2 have left and it's not as nice! There also used to be 2 main staff so they got to know you & there was some consistency.   Shame I think the atmosphere had changed.
